news.title: ‘No evidence of violence’ in death of Irish fashion designer (33) found dead on yacht in New York
news.summary: An autopsy found no evidence of violence in the death of a young Irish woman who was found dead on a yacht in the US, local police have said.

news.title: Revenue is chasing tens of thousands of pensioners over owed tax
news.summary: The Revenue Commissioners have written to thousands of pensioners to warn of incorrect tax payments.

news.title: Man (23) charged over stabbing of garda on Dublin street agrees to stay in custody awaiting DPP directions
news.summary: A 23-year-old man charged over the stabbing of a garda on a Dublin street last week has agreed to stay in prison for another four weeks pending directions from the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP).

news.title: Great games, kick-out chaos and crowd surge: Why it was one of the best Gaelic football summers for years
news.summary: This year’s championship ended on a very familiar soundtrack as Kerry collected a 39th All-Ireland title, one that will rank right up there among the sweetest in their priceless collection.

news.title: Israeli military chief opposes Gaza war expansion, raising pressure on Netanyahu
news.summary: Israel's military chief has pushed back against Benjamin Netanyahu's plans to seize areas of Gaza it doesn't already control, three Israeli officials said, as the prime minister faces increasing pressure over the war both at home and abroad.

news.title: Eoin McGee answers: ‘I’m 26 with €50k in savings and €7k in crypto. Should I invest in shares or buy a house?’
‘I had to track her ashes using a code, like she was a parcel in the post’ – daughter speaks about mother’s assisted death at Swiss clinic
news.summary: The daughter of the Co Cavan-based woman who was assisted in ending her life alone at a controversial Swiss clinic has told of her sadness and disbelief after her ashes were sent home in the post.

news.title: Stunning second half comeback seals Europa League win for Shels on famous night in Croatia
news.summary: The cage housing the away support in Rijeka was never going to be able to contain the delirium created by a stunning second half that gives Shelbourne a shot at glory next Tuesday.

news.title: Saoirse Hanley: The new Penneys app may change the way you shop – but there is a snag
news.summary: Penneys (or Primark, as it's known elsewhere) is a long-standing part of Irish culture: after all, the very first store opened on Dublin’s Mary Street. It’s in our DNA. It’s distinct from other shops by virtue of price, certainly, but also because it has never moved its business online.

news.title: Owners of Wexford pub which hosted surprise Ed Sheeran Fleadh gig – ‘We were sworn to secrecy, it was like MI6’
news.summary: Ed Sheeran and his crew departed the car park of the iconic Sky & The Ground pub in Wexford town to a chorus of screams from fans.
